paper.title: Impartiality, Justice and Fairness: The Ethics of Concurrent Termination
paper.venue: International Colloquium on Automata, Languages and Programming
paper.abstract: The method of well founded structures for proving termination of programs is extended to concurrent programs. The more complicated case is when a program terminates only for fair executions. Different versions of fairness are introduced: Impartiality, Fairness and Justice, and Methods for proving their termination are presented.
